alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 2:50PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past week is causing rapid runoff through the Mississippi River tributaries and eventually the Mississippi River itself. The Mississippi River is expected to reach minor flood stage at Champlin over the weekend. For the Mississippi River...including Hwy 169 at Champlin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.8 feet, Champlin - some flooding downstream of gage on Mississippi Drive At 11.0 feet, Champlin - flooding begins upstream of gage at Galloway Park * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 13.8 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 06/17/1966. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
